pull.title: ensure clean and consistent "namespace" usage

events.body: @diapolo I'm fine with this, but it seems pretty arbitrary to me. Can you document these 'rules' somewhere? For example in doc/coding-style.md?

events.message:
ensure clean and consistent "namespace" usage

- remove some missplaced ;
- ensure end of a namespace is clearly visible
- use same formatting when using namespace

update coding.md to reflect changes by pull

- also mention alphabetical include ordering

events.body:
Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/p4398_86fe1b864b109869659f140af07047163637a673/ for binaries and test log.
This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/current/
Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.

This is the last codestyle-change commit I'm going to merge for a while.

@sipa is working on a clang-format rule to take care of this automatically, then we can do it in one go, instead of breaking everyone's patches all of the time.
@laanwj I would LOVE to see a standardized way of formatting our files! Hope @sipa is pushing this :).
@laanwj Is include file ordering okay or also permitted for now :-P? Yes we have importend stuff to solve, but I get nausea, when looking at such things.
@Diapolo Include file reordering is fine with me, doesn't generally cause conflicts and if so they're trivial to solve. But no whitespace changes for now.

comments.body: Ideally we should also have an if/else if/else statement in here. I always wonder whether to put the } on the same line as the else, etc.
@laanwj Ping, would love to get this cleared up and merged.
